books.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A comedy skewering Victorian high society.

books.title: The Four Just Men
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: To prevent the passage of a controversial government bill, four vigilantes take the law into their own hands.

books.title: The Autobiography of Calvin Coolidge
books.author: Calvin Coolidge
books.summary: The thirtieth president of the United States recounts his life story.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: The Blue Bird
books.author: Maurice Maeterlinck
books.summary: Two children go on a magical adventure in search of the Blue Bird.

books.title: David Harum
books.author: Edward Noyes Westcott
books.summary: An aimless young man leaves the city for a small village to work for a horse-trading country banker.

books.title: The Merchant of Venice
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: To help his friend Bassanio woo the beautiful Portia, the Venetian merchant Antonio borrows a large sum from Shylock, a Jewish moneylender.

books.title: Zuni Folktales
books.author: Frank Hamilton Cushing
books.summary: A collection of folktales from the Zuni culture.

books.title: The Club of Queer Trades
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: Two friends, solving a perceived crime, stumble upon a club for people who have invented their own method of employment.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.summary: An ancient undead monster terrorizes Victorian London.

books.title: Roughing It
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain’s semiautobiographical account of his travel across the United States.

books.title: Kate Plus 10
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A police inspector investigates an enigmatic young woman and her connection with various criminal activities.

books.title: The Book of Tea
books.author: Okakura Kakuzō
books.summary: The Book of Tea is a long essay exploring the relationship between teaism, taoism, and the aesthetics of Japanese culture.

books.title: The Kural
books.author: Thiruvalluvar
books.summary: An Indian weaver-philosopher expounds on the subjects of righteousness, wealth, and love.

books.title: The Kalevala
books.author: Elias Lönnrot
books.summary: The Finnish national epic poem recounting the creation of the Earth and the adventures of its mythical heroes.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Frederik Pohl
books.summary: A collection of science fiction stories by Frederik Pohl ordered by date of publication.

books.title: While the Billy Boils
books.author: Henry Lawson
books.summary: A short story collection based on Australian colonial life in 1890s.

books.title: Unspoken Sermons
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: George MacDonald presents a set of interlocking sermons designed to shape the perception and life of the Christian disciple.

books.title: On a Chinese Screen
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A collection of short vignettes about the people and places W. Somerset Maugham encountered during his travels along the Yangtze River in 1919–20.
